segments.en: My name is Marco and I am joined by... Erica.
segments.cn: 我叫马尔科，我的搭档是... 埃里卡。

segments.en: I'm doing great, Marco and you?
I'm doing really well and I'm really excited about our lesson for today.
segments.cn: 我今天感觉很好，我对今天的课程非常兴奋。

segments.en: We've got an intermediate lesson today and we're going to study some real English.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节中级课程，我们将学习一些真实的英语。

segments.en: English that you use every day, right?
English that native speakers really use.
segments.cn: 本地人真正使用的英语。

segments.en: And today, as Erica mentioned, we have an intermediate lesson.
segments.cn: 今天，正如埃里卡提到的，我们有一节中级课程。

segments.en: And not only is it intermediate, but it's a business lesson.
segments.cn: 而且不仅是中级课程，还是一节商务课程。

segments.en: So today we're listening in to a sales meeting and we're going to learn some great useful English to talk about sales strategies.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们将听一个销售会议，我们将学习一些关于销售策略的实用英语。

segments.en: So we're going to learn English for sales strategies, for making suggestions and for responding to suggestions.
segments.cn: 我们将学习销售策略的英语，提出建议和回应建议的英语。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at our vocabulary preview for today.
segments.cn: 那我们来看看今天的词汇预览吧。

segments.en: So our vocabulary preview is a part of our lesson when we teach you some really important words that will help you to understand the dialogue better.
segments.cn: 词汇预览是我们课程的一部分，我们教你一些非常重要的单词，帮助你更好地理解对话。

segments.en: So that is what vocabulary preview is.
segments.cn: 这就是词汇预览的意义。

segments.en: We have two words for you today.
And we can start off by looking at the first one.
segments.cn: 我们可以先看看第一个。

segments.en: Our first word today is drive sales.
segments.cn: 我们今天的第一个单词是推动销售。

segments.en: Okay, so now let's look at our second word.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们来看第二个单词。

segments.en: So Erica, what is a promotion exactly?
segments.cn: 埃里卡，促销到底是什么？

segments.en: Okay, so here we're not really talking about getting a better job, right?
segments.cn: 好的，这里我们并不是在谈论升职，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, not like a job promotion.
No, we're talking about a marketing strategy.
segments.cn: 不，我们在谈论一种营销策略。

segments.en: Okay, so I can give you an example.
segments.cn: 好的，我可以给你一个例子。

segments.en: Suppose that I want to buy shampoo.
And if I go to the supermarket and I see buy one and get one free.
segments.cn: 如果我去超市，看到买一送一。

segments.en: So that's a two for one.
That's a two for one promotion.
segments.cn: 这是一个买二送一的促销。

segments.en: Or perhaps the shampoo in the supermarket is less expensive than usual.
segments.cn: 或者超市里的洗发水比平时便宜。

segments.en: Yeah, usually maybe it costs five dollars, but today it costs four dollars.
segments.cn: 是的，通常可能要五美元，但今天只要四美元。

segments.en: So that's a really good marketing strategy.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常好的营销策略。

segments.en: And we'll hear this word in our dialogue today.
segments.cn: 我们今天在对话中会听到这个词。

segments.en: So we are ready to listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以我们准备好听我们的对话了。

segments.en: So it might be a little bit difficult to understand.
segments.cn: 所以可能有点难以理解。

segments.en: But don't worry if you don't understand everything.
segments.cn: 但如果你不理解所有内容也不用担心。

segments.en: Because later in this lesson we're going to explain all the important words and phrases.
segments.cn: 因为在这节课的后面，我们会解释所有重要的单词和短语。

segments.en: Alright people, we're holding this meeting today because we've got to do something about our sales.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，今天我们召开这个会议是因为我们必须对我们的销售采取行动。

segments.en: And we need to do it now.
segments.cn: 我们需要立即采取行动。
我想要具体的解决方案。

segments.en: How do you plan to drive sales?
segments.cn: 你们打算如何推动销售？

segments.en: Well, in fact, we're the most expensive in the market.
segments.cn: 实际上，我们在市场上是最贵的。

segments.en: So maybe we need to lower our prices to match the competitors?
segments.cn: 所以也许我们需要降低价格以与竞争对手匹配？
这在斯旺那里是行不通的。

segments.en: What kind of thinking is that?
Maybe a two-for-one offer or something like that.
segments.cn: 可能是买二送一之类的。

segments.en: The CEO will be here any minute.
segments.cn: 首席执行官马上就要来了。

segments.en: Do we have any ideas yet?
We were kind of considering a two-for-one offer to get more competitive.
segments.cn: 我们正在考虑一个买二送一的促销活动，以提高竞争力。

segments.en: I kind of like the sound of that.
It sounds like something we should consider.
segments.cn: 听起来像是我们应该考虑的事情。

segments.en: That's just what I was thinking.
In fact, it's a brilliant idea.
segments.cn: 事实上，这是一个绝妙的主意。

segments.en: I'm glad we thought of that.
segments.cn: 我很高兴我们想到了这一点。

segments.en: Okay, so an interesting manager, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以是个有趣的经理，对吧？

segments.en: Maybe I would think bad manager.
segments.cn: 也许我会认为是个糟糕的经理。

segments.en: We're going to talk about him later on in the show.
segments.cn: 我们稍后会在节目中谈论他。

segments.en: But now let's take a look at our language takeaway.
segments.cn: 但现在让我们看看我们的语言要点。

segments.en: Okay, so language takeaway is the part of our lesson where we teach you the most important words from the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，语言要点是我们课程中教你对话中最重要的单词的部分。

segments.en: All these words that we are going to focus on can be found in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们将要关注的所有这些单词都可以在今天的对话中找到。

segments.en: So we have three words for you today.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们有三个单词给你。

segments.en: Let's look at the first one.
So we have some examples for you so you can listen and try and see if you can figure out what match the competitors really means.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一些例子给你，这样你可以听听，看看你能否弄明白“与竞争对手匹配”到底是什么意思。

segments.en: We guarantee that we can match the competitors' lowest price.
segments.cn: 我们保证可以与竞争对手的最低价格匹配。

segments.en: It's impossible for us to match the competitors.
segments.cn: 我们无法与竞争对手匹配。

segments.en: Our costs are just too high.
Do you think we can match our competitors' prices and still keep our quality high?
segments.cn: 你认为我们能与竞争对手的价格匹配，同时保持高质量吗？

segments.en: So I see that match the competitors means to be as good as or better than other companies in the same industry.
segments.cn: 所以我明白“与竞争对手匹配”意味着在同一行业中与其他公司一样好或更好。

segments.en: Alright, so let's move to our second word today for language takeaways and it is in the market.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们进入今天语言要点的第二个单词，它是“在市场上”。

segments.en: We heard this phrase in the dialogue and it means in the industry.
segments.cn: 我们在对话中听到了这个短语，它的意思是“在行业中”。

segments.en: I can say, for example, EnglishPod is the best language pod in the market.
segments.cn: 我可以说，例如，EnglishPod是市场上最好的语言播客。

segments.en: So of all the podcasts that teach English, EnglishPod is the best.
segments.cn: 所以在所有教英语的播客中，EnglishPod是最好的。

segments.en: Of course, no doubt about it.
Or I can give you another example.
segments.cn: 或者我可以给你另一个例子。

segments.en: iPods are the most popular MP3 players in the market.
segments.cn: iPod是市场上最受欢迎的MP3播放器。

segments.en: So of all the MP3 players in the world, iPods are the most popular.
segments.cn: 所以在世界上所有的MP3播放器中，iPod是最受欢迎的。

segments.en: So let's move to our final word for today and it is...
segments.cn: 现在让我们进入今天的最后一个单词，它是...

segments.en: So this phrase sounds a little bit strange.
segments.cn: 所以这个短语听起来有点奇怪。

segments.en: Are we talking about an airplane here?
So we're going to give you some examples and try and guess what it'll never fly really means.
segments.cn: 所以我们将给你一些例子，试着猜测“它永远不会成功”到底是什么意思。

segments.en: This marketing plan will never fly.
segments.cn: 这个营销计划永远不会成功。

segments.en: You want to sell bikinis in Alaska?
segments.cn: 你想在阿拉斯加卖比基尼？

segments.en: Brad told me his idea for a film script, but the story will never fly.
segments.cn: 布拉德告诉我他的电影剧本的想法，但这个故事永远不会成功。

segments.en: So it means it won't work.
segments.cn: 所以它的意思是它行不通。

segments.en: So now we've seen a lot of useful phrases and we are ready to listen to our dialogue a second time.
segments.cn: 所以现在我们已经看到了很多有用的短语，我们准备第二次听我们的对话。

segments.en: But this time it's going to be slow.
So you'll be able to understand a little bit better and you'll be able to hear the words and phrases we were just talking about.
segments.cn: 这样你就能更好地理解，并且能够听到我们刚才谈论的单词和短语。

segments.en: We're holding this meeting today because we've got to do something about our sales.
segments.cn: 我们今天召开这个会议是因为我们必须对我们的销售采取行动。

segments.en: And we need to do it now.
segments.cn: 而且我们需要立即采取行动。
我想要具体的解决方案。

segments.en: How do you plan to drive sales, Roger?
segments.cn: 你打算如何推动销售，罗杰？

segments.en: Well, um, in fact, we're the most expensive in the market.
segments.cn: 嗯，实际上，我们在市场上是最贵的。

segments.en: So maybe we need to lower our prices to match the competitors.
segments.cn: 所以也许我们需要降低价格以与竞争对手匹配。
这在斯旺那里永远不会成功。

segments.en: What kind of thinking is that?
Anybody else have a better plan?
segments.cn: 还有其他人有更好的计划吗？

segments.en: Maybe a two-for-one offer or something like that.
segments.cn: 也许是买一送一的优惠或类似的东西。

segments.en: The CEO will be here any minute.
segments.cn: 首席执行官马上就要来了。

segments.en: Do we have any ideas yet?
We were kind of considering a two-for-one offer to get more competitive.
segments.cn: 我们考虑过买一送一的优惠，以提高竞争力。

segments.en: I kind of like the sound of that.
segments.cn: 我觉得这个听起来不错。

segments.en: It sounds like something we should consider.
segments.cn: 听起来是我们应该考虑的事情。

segments.en: That's just what I was thinking.
In fact, that's a brilliant idea.
segments.cn: 事实上，这是个绝妙的主意。

segments.en: I'm glad we thought of that.
segments.cn: 我很高兴我们想到了这个。

segments.en: I hope everyone understands a lot better now.
segments.cn: 我希望大家现在能更好地理解。

segments.en: And I hope everyone could listen out for some of those key words.
segments.cn: 我希望大家能留意一些关键词。

segments.en: So now it's time for us to take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在是时候看看流利度提升器了。

segments.en: So with Fluency Builder, we try to help you increase your fluency.
segments.cn: 在流利度提升器中，我们试图帮助你提高流利度。

segments.en: We take a word or phrase that you already know and show you how to say it a little bit more naturally.
segments.cn: 我们会拿一个你已经知道的单词或短语，教你如何更自然地说出来。

segments.en: A little bit more like a native English speaker.
segments.cn: 更像是一个以英语为母语的人。

segments.en: And we have three of these words for you today.
segments.cn: 今天我们有三个这样的单词给你。

segments.en: Let's start with the first one.
Okay, so often students will say something like...
segments.cn: 好的，学生们常常会说类似于...
或者... 我会很快到达。

segments.en: They're totally fine, but I think there's a better way to say this.
segments.cn: 完全没问题，但我觉得有更好的说法。

segments.en: And we heard it in the dialogue, so let's listen to what the person in the dialogue said.
segments.cn: 我们在对话中听到了，所以让我们听听对话中的人说了什么。

segments.en: Okay, so be here any minute.
It just sounds a little bit more natural.
Yeah, I think I use this phrase quite often.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得我经常使用这个短语。

segments.en: Okay, so let's move on to our second phrase for Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们继续到流利度提升器的第二个短语。

segments.en: So this phrase will help you to learn how to say I'm thinking about something in a better sounding way.
segments.cn: 这个短语将帮助你更好地表达“我在考虑某事”。

segments.en: So you can say something like...
We are thinking about a sales strategy.
segments.cn: 我们在考虑一个销售策略。

segments.en: Or... That sounds like something we should think about.
segments.cn: 或者... 听起来像是我们应该考虑的事情。

segments.en: Yeah, there's no problem with this.
But in the dialogue we heard something a little bit different, so let's listen to it.
segments.cn: 但在对话中我们听到了稍微不同的说法，所以让我们听听。

segments.en: So consider sounds like a pretty natural way of saying it, right?
segments.cn: 所以“考虑”听起来是个很自然的说法，对吧？

segments.en: I think it sounds really kind of smart.
segments.cn: 我觉得这听起来很聪明。

segments.en: Yeah, it sounds more formal even.
So let's move on to our third word.
segments.cn: 让我们继续到第三个单词。

segments.en: Marco, you already said our third word.
segments.cn: 马尔科，你已经说出了我们的第三个单词。

segments.en: That's a great word right there.
A lot of people might say, that's a great idea, or great.
segments.cn: 很多人可能会说，这是个好主意，或者很好。

segments.en: But in the dialogue we heard another way of saying the same idea.
segments.cn: 但在对话中我们听到了另一种表达同样想法的方式。

segments.en: so this is great, but I would have to say that it's a little bit more British English.
segments.cn: 所以这很好，但我得说这有点偏向英式英语。

segments.en: Yeah, I'd agree with you there, but I also think it sort of gives more power to this idea that it's a good idea, brilliant idea.
segments.cn: 是的，我同意你的看法，但我也觉得这更能强调这是个好主意，绝妙的主意。

segments.en: That it's a really, really good idea.
segments.cn: 这是个非常非常好的主意。

segments.en: Okay, so we're ready to listen to our dialogue again a third time, but at its normal speed.
segments.cn: 好的，我们准备好再次以正常速度听我们的对话了。

segments.en: Alright people, we're holding this meeting today because we've got to do something about our sales, and we need to do it now.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我们今天召开这个会议是因为我们必须对我们的销售采取行动，而且我们需要立即行动。
我想要具体的解决方案。

segments.en: How do you plan to drive sales?
segments.cn: 你们打算如何推动销售？

segments.en: Well, in fact, we're the most expensive in the market, so maybe we need to lower our prices to match the competitors?
segments.cn: 嗯，实际上，我们在市场上是最贵的，所以也许我们需要降低价格以与竞争对手匹配？
这在斯旺那里是行不通的。

segments.en: What kind of thinking is that?
Maybe a two for one offer, or something like that.
segments.cn: 或者是买一送一之类的优惠。

segments.en: The CEO will be here any minute.
Do we have any ideas yet?
We were kind of considering a two for one offer to get more competitive.
segments.cn: 我们考虑过一个买一送一的优惠，以提高竞争力。

segments.en: I kind of like the sound of that.
It sounds like something we should consider.
segments.cn: 听起来是我们应该考虑的事情。

segments.en: That's just what I was thinking.
In fact, it's a brilliant idea.
segments.cn: 事实上，这是个绝妙的主意。

segments.en: I'm glad we thought of that.
segments.cn: 我很高兴我们想到了这个。

segments.en: Alright, so listening to this dialogue makes you think about this boss.
segments.cn: 好吧，听这个对话让你想到了这个老板。

segments.en: I'm pretty sure everyone has had a manager or a supervisor that's similar to this guy.
segments.cn: 我敢肯定每个人都有过类似于这个家伙的经理或主管。

segments.en: I would have to say he sounds like a terrible person to work for.
segments.cn: 我得说，他听起来是个糟糕的上司。

segments.en: If you're a manager, you want to motivate your employees.
segments.cn: 如果你是经理，你想要激励你的员工。

segments.en: I think it's the most important thing a manager does is to encourage his or her employees and to help support them to grow and to be better people in the job.
segments.cn: 我认为经理最重要的事情就是鼓励员工，帮助他们成长，成为更好的人。

segments.en: And this guy is totally not doing this.
segments.cn: 而这个家伙完全没有做到这一点。

segments.en: And you can tell because they are a little bit scared of talking and he cuts them off with saying, Oh, it's a bad idea.
segments.cn: 你可以看得出来，因为他们有点害怕说话，他会打断他们，说，哦，这是个糟糕的主意。

segments.en: Give me a better idea and stuff like that.
segments.cn: 给我一个更好的主意之类的。

segments.en: Yeah, I could never work for a guy like this.
segments.cn: 是的，我绝对无法为这样的人工作。

segments.en: You know, my first boss that I had when I first entered the workforce, I was in a very junior position and I was working for a large company and the general manager of the company, he was amazing.
segments.cn: 你知道，我第一份工作时的老板，我当时是个非常初级的职位，我在一家大公司工作，而公司的总经理，他真是太棒了。

segments.en: He knew every single employee's name, first name, and he would, you know, make an effort to stop and say hello and ask them how things were going.
segments.cn: 他知道每个员工的名字，并且会努力停下来问候他们，询问他们的情况。

segments.en: And you know what, this left me with such a good feeling about the company that I really wanted to work hard for this company and try my best.
segments.cn: 你知道吗，这让我对公司有了很好的感觉，我真的很想为这家公司努力工作，尽我所能。

segments.en: And I think that I've never met such a great boss as this guy.
segments.cn: 我认为我从未遇到过像他这样优秀的老板。

segments.en: Definitely, if you have a boss that's encouraging and motivating like that, it makes you work harder and makes you feel part of a really special team.
segments.cn: 绝对的，如果你有一个像这样鼓励和激励的老板，会让你更加努力工作，并让你感到自己是一个特别团队的一部分。

segments.en: And that's something we can all agree on and I'm sure all our managers out there do the same.
segments.cn: 这是我们都能达成共识的事情，我相信我们所有的经理也是如此。

segments.en: Well, you know what, I hope some of our listeners log on to our website and maybe they can tell us some experiences with bad managers or good managers or if they are managers, how they handle things.
segments.cn: 好吧，你知道吗，我希望我们的听众能登录我们的网站，也许他们可以告诉我们一些关于糟糕经理或优秀经理的经历，或者如果他们是经理，他们是如何处理事情的。

segments.en: Yeah, and hopefully they can use some of these great phrases that we talked about today.
segments.cn: 是的，希望他们能使用我们今天讨论的一些好短语。

segments.en: Great, so be sure everyone to visit our website at EnglishPod.com and where you can find a lot of other information and really good resources to continue improving your English.
segments.cn: 很好，所以大家一定要访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，在那里你可以找到很多其他信息和非常好的资源来继续提高你的英语。

segments.en: So thanks for listening today, everyone.
segments.cn: 所以谢谢大家今天的收听。

segments.en: And until next time, this is goodbye.
